subject: Prevent admin users from changing size and checksum in v1 api

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message:
Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am actually surprised we allow this right now.

Couple of questions/points:
(1) I think we should raise an exception so user is aware that this is not permitted. Is this breaking api contract?
(2) Tests please :)
(3) Do you think the deserializer is a better place to put it in?
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v1/images.py#L1004

Patch Set 1:

+1 on Iccha's first comment. We should raise a 400 and make sure users know that such modification is not permitted. (explanation while raising should help on that line)

I'm not sure if it's breaking contract or not. We should try to find use cases for places it does. (so action item for everyone :D)

Now that you've mentioned about deserializer, I'm wondering if we should allow this for admins and check for it either in the authorization layer or at the db layer for glance-admin context (not sure about user admins).

Patch Set 1:

thanks for the feedback, I'll add tests and change it so that it raise; on allowing admins, my understanding is that being size the actual image file size, this really shouldn't have to be changed but I'm looking for comments on this

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Echoing the comments of iccha and nikhil. And plus my 2 cents.
1. Agree we should raise an exception, 400?
2. Need unit test
3. Given it seems like a validation, so it would be nice to fix it in deserializer
4. I'm not sure if we should allow the gate for admin/deployer to change the size. Actually, I'm always hesitating if we should let the admin to be the superman.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 3:

seems to break compatibility with existing tests in tempest, what shall we do?

Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As far as tempest is concerned, we should modify the tests there as well and have a dependency specified on this patch. (#openstack-infra folks might be able to give more insight on that process, if so)

Also, we should have a "docImpact" flag in the commit message (I believe).

In response to you question on IRC: yes, we should do it in deserialize and ensure this is checked on "create" and "update" calls.

Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

'-1' for the message (as per my comment).

Also, I tried with this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40619/ to make image size immutable (except for admin users), I'd like to understand which v1 API calls still allow image size to be changed -- thanks!

Patch Set 3:

hi Stuart, thanks for reviewing my submission and pointing me at your changes.

To be honest, at this point I'm not really sure what is the expected behaviour v1 should have. AFAIK v2 considers size and checksum immutable (even by admin), that makes sense to me, especially if image data is supposed immutable.

I wonder why that shouldn't hold true for v1? Previous comments seem to suggest we should make size and checksum readonly in _deserialize which means make them immutable regardless of the user issuing the request. What do you think about?
Uploaded patch set 4.

Patch Set 4:

I'm still wondering if this should be checked for the image with 'saving' status too.

Patch Set 4:

I previously commented that this patch:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40619 

should already make image size immutable (except for admin users)

Can you please provide details of which v1 API calls still allow image size to be changed? Thanks.

Patch Set 4:

hi Stuart, this is intended to prevent updates to size and checksum also to admins.

Patch Set 4:

Thanks Guilio for the clarification.

Could you update the commit message to reflect this? (ie explain that the change prevents an admin updating the metadata -- the current message reads as if the change affects all users).

Also could you give an explanation of why you feel this change is needed? (Its often a good idea to include the 'why' in the commit message, in addition to the 'what'.)

Thanks!

Patch Set 4:

hi Stuart, I'll update the commit message with my next patchset but please not that this is intended to prevent updates to all users, as you noticed, not just to admins.

On the reasons, there has been some quick conversation on IRC but it is certainly good to wrap up it here:

the basic idea is that updates to an image size and checksum shouldn't happen after the image data becomes available, neither of the two is subject to change especially considering image data immutable; v2 api makes size and checksum readonly attributes so with this change v1 will basically behave as v2

we also reject images at the time of uploading if the size posted in the request does not match the real image size, so this change just builds up on your previous changes preventing all users from modifying that
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 5:

Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Couple of nits in-line.

I'm still wondering whether:

1) Changing the API v1 is something we want (v2 should be the way to go now)
2) What could be the impact of this from a admin perspective? Say I upload an image and the store doesn't return the right size. An admin won't be able to fix that. What should be the recommended action then?

Also, please take a look at blueprint split-image-size

Patch Set 5:

While we're picking nits, should the subject be more something like "Prevent admin users from changing size and checksum in v1". For me that better describes the change in behaviour.

I wrote the original patch to restrict size changes to admin users only. I was thinking of fsck type operations which an admin or script may want to perform.

Tbh I don't care too much if that ability is taken away ... I guess I'm neutral on whether this is an improvement or not. (An alternative route to consistency would be allow admin to set size/checksum in v2).

Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

Stuart, I'll use the message you propose in next patchset!

Flavio, thanks for reviewing this. The expectations here are primarily to prevent updates to images that do have size/checksum set but still, in the use case you mention where a store does not return size, is an admin going to set the image size manually for every upload? Also, this isn't possible with v2 api so why endorse it in v1 api?
Uploaded patch set 6.
